qahramon

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • qahramon.Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Armor, Backpack, Purse, Weapon

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class of items involving an identification, a class type, a termination state, an identification, a weight, a value, a character and a parent backpack.
    Version:
    1.0 - 2019
    Author:
    Robin Bruneel, Jean-Louis Carron, Edward Wiels
    Invariants:
  • Each item must have a unique and valid identification number.
        canHaveAsIdentification(getIdentification())
  • Each item must have a valid weight.
        isValidWeight(getWeight())
  • Each item must have a valid value.
        canHaveAsValue(getValue())
  • Each item must have a proper character when bound.
        getCharacter() == null || hasProperCharacter()
  • Each item must have a proper parent backpack when bound.
        getParentBackpack() == null || hasProperParentBackpack()

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminate this item.
        Postcondition:
        Set terminated state to true.
            isTerminated() == true
        Effect:
        Drop this item to break all associations.
            drop()

      • canHaveAsIdentification

        @Raw
public abstract boolean canHaveAsIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether this class can have this id as identification where id doesn't have to be unique.
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to be checked
        Returns:
        Return true when this class can have this id as identification where id doesn't have to be unique. Return false otherwise.

public abstract boolean canHaveAsNewIdentification(long identification)
        Check whether this class can have this id as identification where the given id has to be unique.
        Parameters:
        identification - the identification to be checked
        Returns:
        Return true when this class can have this id as identification where the given id has to be unique. Return false otherwise.

        public static boolean isValidWeight(float weight)
        Check whether the given weight is valid.
        Parameters:
        weight - the weight to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given weight is valid, thus positive. Return false otherwise.
            weight >= 0

        @Basic
 @Raw
public int getValue()

      • canHaveAsValue

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsValue(int value)
        Check whether the given value is valid.
        Parameters:
        value - the integer checked for its validity
        Returns:
        Return true if the given value lies between the minimum and maximum value. Return false otherwise.
            result == value >= getMinValue() && value <= getMaxValue()

      • getCharacter

        @Basic
public Character getCharacter()
        Return the item's character.
        Returns:
        Return the item's character.

      • hasProperCharacter

        @Raw
public boolean hasProperCharacter()
        Check whether this item has a proper character.
        Returns:
        Return true when this item can have the current character and the character has this item anchored. Return false otherwise.
            result == canHaveAsCharacter(getCharacter()) && getCharacter().hasAnchored(this)

      • canHaveAsCharacter

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsCharacter(Character character)
        Check whether this item can have the given character.
        Parameters:
        character - the character to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given character is not null. Return false otherwise.
            result == character != null

      • getParentBackpack

        @Basic
public Backpack getParentBackpack()
        Return the item's parent backpack.
        Returns:
        Return the item's parent backpack.

      • hasProperParentBackpack

        @Raw
public boolean hasProperParentBackpack()
        Check whether this item has a proper backpack.
        Returns:
        Return true when this item can have the given backpack and the backpack contains this item. Return false otherwise.
            result == canHaveAsParentBackpack(getParentBackpack()) && getParentBackpack().contains(this)

      • canHaveAsParentBackpack

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsParentBackpack(Backpack backpack)
        Check whether this item can have the given backpack.
        Parameters:
        backpack - the backpack to check
        Returns:
        Return true when the given backpack is not null, not terminated and the given backpack can have this item. Return false otherwise.
            result == backpack != null && !backpack.isTerminated() && backpack.canHaveAsItem(this)

      • drop

        public void drop()
        Drop this item to the ground.
        Effects:
      • When this item is anchored, the holder of the item is set to null(= on the ground). Since this is a bidirectional relation, the item is also removed from the holder.
            this.getCharacter().removeItemFromHolder(this)
            this.setCharacter(null)
      • When this item is in a backpack, the parent backpack of this item is set to null and since this is a bidirectional, the item is also removed from the backpack.
            this.getParentBackpack().removeItem(this)
            this.setParentBackpack(null)

      • getHolder

        public Character getHolder()
        Return the holder of this item.
        Returns:
        Return the character associated when equipped on an anchor or get the holder recursively when this item is in a backpack. When a backpack does not have a holder this method returns null.
            result == if (getCharacter() != null) then getCharacter()
             else if (getParentBackpack() != null) then getParentBackpack().getHolder()
             else null
        Note:
        If the holder is null, this item lies on the ground.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Backpack backpack)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   TerminatedException
        Move this item to the given backpack.
        Parameters:
        backpack - the backpack to move this item to
        Postcondition:
        Moves this item to the given backpack
            backpack.containsItem(this)
            new.getParentBackpack() == backpack
            new.getCharacter() == null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this error when the given backpack can not have this item. | !backpack.canHaveAsItem(this)
        TerminatedException - Throws this error when this item is terminated. | this.isTerminated()
